medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 12 weeks 1 day’s gestation, with the patient receiving routine prenatal care thereafter. At 20 weeks 6 days’ gestation, ultrasound showed signs consistent with placenta accreta, which progressed to a diagnosis confirmed at 27 weeks of gestation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gravida 5, para 4 with two normal vaginal deliveries and two previous cesarean sections. History of iron-deficiency anemia with prior iron supplementation discontinued due to gastrointestinal intolerance. A positive tuberculosis skin test eight years earlier with treatment completed.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hypertension; father had hypertension and epilepsy and died at age 70; sister had sickle cell trait.
medical_history.social_history: Works in the healthcare field, does not drink alcohol, smoke, or use illicit drugs, and resides with her husband and children.
